definition: joy of first experience (idiom)/the pleasure of reading sth for the first time
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: You don't understand. They want to become the first to see it.
sentences.chinese: 你们不知道，他们是想先睹为快。

sentences.english: The following is the chapters content of the book for your preview.
sentences.chinese: 为了给诸君先睹为快，以下是该书的目录。

sentences.english: You can see what it’s like behind the scenes on Showtime’s "Deeper Throat".
sentences.chinese: 你可以通过其演示片“更深的喉”先睹为快。

sentences.english: The material was obtained by WikiLeaks and made available to a number of news organizations in advance.
sentences.chinese: 这批资料被维基解密获得，一些媒体先睹为快。

definition: to look/to have a glimpse at/to observe (sth's splendor)
to take a look at/to examine/to survey/(coll.) pretty soon
to explore a mystery/to probe the unknown
to have a taste of/to realize/to appreciate
news from behind the scenes/stage gossip
lit. to wipe one's eyes and wait (idiom); to wait and see
